transcript.title: ZIMBABWE: COMMONWEALTH LEADERS MEETING
transcript.content:
As Chairman in Office of the Commonwealth, I have decided to convene a special meeting in London on Tuesday 19 March of the three leaders mandated by CHOGM to consider and act upon the report of the Commonwealth Observer Group monitoring Zimbabwe';s recent election.
This decision has been taken following consultations involving Secretary General Don McKinnon, and my two fellow Commonwealth leaders - President Mbeki of South Africa and President Obasanjo of Nigeria.
The Commonwealth Observer Group has released a preliminary report, and I expect shortly to receive the Group';s full report, which will be the basis for our deliberations in London. Circumstances clearly require our close, urgent and objective attention to the issues raised.
